Sentencas: Conventionally, the reversible potential at inlet conditions is considered to be the ideal voltage for a fuel cell.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: However, the reversible potential in planar cells varies along the cell length due to changes in gas composition caused by consumption of fuel and oxidant.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: This contributes to voltage losses, referred to as Nernst losses, compared to the reversible potential at the inlet of the cell.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: In the conventional breakdown of cell voltage losses, the variation of reversible potential is not accounted for.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: To estimate the true losses, this needs to be accounted for by employing calculations of the reversible potential with changing composition.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: This paper quantifies such losses in the context of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) for which they are found to contribute significantly, in the range of 25 to 33% of the total voltage losses.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: The Nernst equation for fuel cell operation is analyzed and analytical expressions for Nernst losses are derived.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters

Sentencas: The latter allows prediction of the effects of operating parameters which are later verified with an isothermal model of the SOFC.
Titulo: Nernst voltage losses in planar fuel cells caused by changes in chemical composition: effects of operating parameters
